xml:lang="en">Ontology for the representation of the software infrastructure</dc:title> <dc:creator>Julián Arenas-Guerrero (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)</dc:creator> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">This ontology defines the terms that can be used to represent the workflows (and their corresponding actions) that are commonly used in a DevOps environment, so as to provide support to tasks related to account management, patch upgrades, scaling up of services, service deployments, etc. This ontology is part of the devops-infra ontology network that has been created in the context of a collaboration between the Ontology Engineering Group at Universidad Politécnica de Madrid and Huawei Research Ireland</rdfs:comment> <dc:creator>David Chaves-Fraga (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)</dc:creator> <vann:preferredNamespacePrefix>devopsprod</vann:preferredNamespacePrefix> <terms:hasFormat>http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow.owl</terms:hasFormat> <dc:creator>Hu Peng (Huawei Research Ireland)</dc:creator> <vann:preferredNamespaceUri>http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#</vann:preferredNamespaceUri> <dc:title xml:lang="en">Ontology for the representation of aspects related to certificates (SSL, CFCA, etc.)</dc:title> <terms:hasFormat>http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center.owl</terms:hasFormat> </owl:Ontology>

<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#containsCertificate -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#containsCertificate"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificateBundle"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificate"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Digital Certificate Bundle contains several Digital Certificates</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">contains certificate</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#hasCertificateDeployment -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#hasCertificateDeployment"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificate"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificateDeployment"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A digital certificate can be deployed somewhere, and this is registered as a Digital Certificate Deployment</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">has certificate deployment</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#hasCertificateSigningRequest -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#hasCertificateSigningRequest"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificate"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#CertificateSigningRequest"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Digital Certificate is obtained after a Certificate Signing Request</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">has certificate signing request</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#usesDigitalCertificate -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#usesDigitalCertificate"> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/certificate#DigitalCertificate"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Different types of entities (domains, servers, etc.) make use of one or several digital certificates</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">uses digital certificate</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#dependsOn -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#dependsOn"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#status -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#status"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#allowsConnectionVia -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#allowsConnectionVia"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenterConnection"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center can be connected through a Data Center Connection</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">allows connection via</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#connectionType -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#connectionType"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenterConnection"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/connection-type"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The type of connection established to a Data Center. It can be MSTP (Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol), IPSecVPN, etc.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">connection type</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#dataCenterConnectionType -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#dataCenterConnectionType"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#dataCenterType -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#dataCenterType"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/data-center-type"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The type of a Data Center. For example, it may be and Internet Data Center (IDC) or a Virtual Data Center providing Infrastructure as a Service (IAAS).</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">data center type</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#endInternetDataCenter -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#endInternetDataCenter"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#hostedInDataCenter -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#hostedInDataCenter"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#hosts -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#hosts"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:unionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#ResourceGroup"/> </owl:unionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Data Center may host a number of physical and logical items (frames, servers, service clusters, BGPAS, etc.)</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">hosts</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#inDataCenter -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#inDataCenter"> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Property used to indicate that a resource (e.g., a Server) is running or located in a data center</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Property used to relate any Resource (e.g, a Sever) with the Data Center where it is hosted</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">in data center</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#locatedIn -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#locatedIn"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#Location"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center is placed in a Location, with a specific GPS position, city, region and timezone</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">located In</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#locatedInSite -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#locatedInSite"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Site"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center is located in a Site</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">located in site</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersIPAddress -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersIPAddress"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center offers IP Addresses to its customers</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">offers IP Address</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersIPNetwork -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersIPNetwork"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPNetwork"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center offers an IP Network to its customers</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">offers IP Network</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersNetworkSegment -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#offersNetworkSegment"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#NetworkSegment"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center offers a Network Segment to its customers</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">offers Network Segment</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#startInternetDataCenter -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#startInternetDataCenter"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#supports -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#supports"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/data-center#DataCenter"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The Data Center may support specific resource requirements or capacity</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">supports</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#backupStatus -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#backupStatus"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#DatabaseScanReport"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/status"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The status of a backup. It can be normal or abnormal.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">backup status</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#belongsToDatabase -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#belongsToDatabase"> <rdfs:subPropertyOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#database"/> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#DatabaseBigTable"/> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#Database"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The database to which a Big Table belongs</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">belongs to database</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#database -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#database"> <rdfs:range rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#Database"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The database to which a replica, scan report, big table or instance relates to.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">database</rdfs:comment> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbBinaryLogChangeStatus -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbBinaryLogChangeStatus"> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/status"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The status of a binary log change for a Database Instance or a Database Scan Report, which may be normal or abnormal. The binary log contains a record of all changes to the databases, both data and structure. It consists of a set of binary log files and an index. It is necessary for replication, and can also be used to restore data after a backup.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">binary log change status</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbMonitorRole -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbMonitorRole"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#DatabaseInstance"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/db-monitor-role"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The role of a DB monitor for a DB instance. It can be Master, Slave, MasterAndSlave, Read, Single. Database monitoring refers to the tasks associated with examining the operational status of a database, and is a vital activity for the maintenance of the performance and health of a database management system</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">database monitor role</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbMonitorStatus -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbMonitorStatus"> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/status"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The status of a DB monitor for a DB instance or a DB Scan Report. It can be normal or abnormal. Database monitoring refers to the tasks associated with examining the operational status of a database, and is a vital activity for the maintenance of the performance and health of a database management system</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">db monitor status</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbStatus -->
<owl:ObjectProperty rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbStatus"> <rdfs:domain rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#Database"/> <rdfs:range> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/status"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </rdfs:range> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">The status of a DB. It can be normal or abnormal.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">db status</rdfs:label> </owl:ObjectProperty>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/database#dbType -->

<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Disk -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Disk"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareItem"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#diskSize"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#diskSize"/> <owl:minQualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:minQualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#diskType"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A disk, understood as a piece of hardware. It can be of different types, and have size.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Disk</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#F5Hardware -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#F5Hardware"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#ServerHardware"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A specific type of hardware from the company F5.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">F5 Hardware</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Firewall -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Firewall"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#ServerHardware"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A specific type of hardware (network security device, which may be virtualised in some cases) that monitors incoming and outgoing network traffic and permits or blocks data packets based on a set of security rules. Its purpose is to establish a barrier between the internal network and incoming traffic from external sources (such as the internet) in order to block malicious traffic like viruses and hackers.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Firewall</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Frame -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Frame"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareItem"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#frameType"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A frame, also known as rack, is a supporting framework that holds hardware modules. In this context, racks typically contain servers, hard disk drives and other computing equipment. Racks make it possible to contain a lot of equipment in a small physical footprint without requiring shelving.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Frame</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareBatch -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareBatch"> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#contractNumber"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#hardwareType"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#unitPrice"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Hardware Batch is a batch under which some hardware infrastructure was bought, kept for administrative purposes or to detect potential problems in the same batch</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Hardware Batch</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>

<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareItem"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#cabPosition"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#dateEnabled"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#managementLink"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#serialNumber"/> <owl:maxQualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:maxQualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A piece of hardware that can be found in the context of a DevOps infrastructure</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Hardware Item</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#NetworkCard -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#NetworkCard"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareItem"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A network interface controller (NIC, also known as a network interface card, network adapter, LAN adapter or physical network interface, and by similar terms) is a computer hardware component that connects a computer to a computer network, usually a LAN. It is considered a piece of computer hardware. Most modern computers support an internal network interface controller embedded in the motherboard directly rather than provided as an external component.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Network Card</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#ServerHardware -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#ServerHardware"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#HardwareItem"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Server Hardware is any type of hardware that can be found inside a frame. It includes firewalls, switches, F5 machines, etc.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Server Hardware</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Switch -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#Switch"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/hardware#ServerHardware"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A network switch (also called switching hub, bridging hub, and, by the IEEE, MAC bridge) is networking hardware that connects devices on a computer network by using packet switching to receive and forward data to the destination device</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Switch</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#DNSDomain -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#DNSDomain"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A DNS is a directory of domain names that align with IP addresses (so called DNS IP in this ontology)</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">DNS Domain</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#DNSRecord -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#DNSRecord"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A DNS record, which can be an A/AAAA record or a service (SRV) record, is a specification of data in the Domain Name System defining the location, i.e., the hostname and port number, of servers for specified services. It is defined in RFC 2782, and its type code is 33. Some Internet protocols such as the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) and the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) often require SRV support by network elements.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">DNS Record</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#FirewallCluster -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#FirewallCluster"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A firewall cluster is a logical cluster of firewalls to allow high availability.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Firewall Cluster</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">An Internet Protocol address (IP address) is a numerical label assigned to each device connected to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication. An IP address serves two main functions: host or network interface identification and location addressing.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">IP Address</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPNetwork -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPNetwork"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">An IP network is a communication network that uses Internet Protocol (IP) to send and receive messages between one or more computers. As one of the most commonly used global networks, an IP network is implemented in Internet networks, local area networks (LAN) and enterprise networks. An IP network requires that all hosts or network nodes be configured with the TCP/IP suite.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">IP Network</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#NetworkSegment -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#NetworkSegment"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A network segment is a portion of a computer network. The nature and extent of a segment depends on the nature of the network and the device or devices used to interconnect end stations.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Network Segment</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PrivateIPAddress -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PrivateIPAddress"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A private IP address is an internal address that is not routed on the Internet, working on a local network.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Private IP Address</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PublicIPAddress -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PublicIPAddress"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A public IP address, in common parlance, is a globally routable unicast IP address, meaning that the address is not an address reserved for use in private networks, such as those reserved by RFC 1918, or the various IPv6 address formats of local scope or site-local scope, for example for link-local addressing. Public IP addresses may be used for communication between hosts on the global Internet.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Public IP Address</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PublicNATEntry -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#PublicNATEntry"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Network address translation (NAT) is a method of remapping an IP address space into another by modifying network address information in the IP header of packets while they are in transit across a traffic routing device. A Public NAT Entry contains information about the wahy in which a source IP address and port is transformed into a destination IP address and port</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Public NAT Entry</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#SSHChannel -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#SSHChannel"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A secure channel over an unsecured network by using a client–server architecture, connecting an SSH client application with an SSH server</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">SSH Channel</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#VirtualFloatingIPAddress -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#VirtualFloatingIPAddress"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/network#IPAddress"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A virtual (floating) IP address is an IP address that doesn't correspond to an actual physical network interface. Uses for VIPs include network address translation (especially, one-to-many NAT), fault-tolerance, and mobility.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Virtual Floating IP Address</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Scope -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Scope"/>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Site -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Site"/>

<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Tenant"/>

<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#BusinessProduct"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#hasProductOffering"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#ProductOffering"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#offeredBy"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Scope"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#uses"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#Service"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#isDeleted"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#boolean"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Business Product that is offered in the catalogue of an organisation (e.g., a content delivery network, an application, etc.)</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Business Product</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#BusinessProductInstance -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#BusinessProductInstance"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#site"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Site"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#tenant"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/organisation#Tenant"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#deployedInstanceOf"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#BusinessProduct"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#uses"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#ServiceInstance"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#deployedInstanceOf"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onClass rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/product#BusinessProduct"/> </owl:Restriction> <!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/server#BareMetalServer -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/server#BareMetalServer"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/server#PhysicalServer"/> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A bare-metal server is a computer server that hosts one tenant, or consumer, only. The term is used for distinguishing between servers that can host multiple tenants and which utilize virtualisation and cloud hosting. Such servers are used by a single consumer and are not shared between consumers. Each server may run any amount of work for a user, or have multiple simultaneous users, but they are dedicated entirely to the entity who is renting them. Unlike servers in a data centre, they are not being shared between multiple customers.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Bare-metal Server</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>

<owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A flavor defines the size of a virtual server that can be <!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/software#SoftwareDirectory -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/software#SoftwareDirectory"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/software#parentDirectory"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/software#SoftwareDirectory"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">This class refers to a Software Directory where files, service modules, etc., are located in the context of a DevOps infrastructure</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Software Directory</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflow -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflow"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Workflow"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#consistsOf"/> <owl:allValuesFrom> <owl:Class> <owl:unionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflow"/> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask"/> </owl:unionOf> </owl:Class> </owl:allValuesFrom> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Direct Workflow consists of tasks combined in a graph where every next task starts after another one depending on produced result. So direct workflow has a notion of transition. Direct workflow is considered to be completed if there aren’t any transitions left that could be used to jump to next tasks.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Direct Workflow</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Task"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#onComplete"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#onError"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#onSuccess"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#DirectWorkflowTask"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Task in a Direct Workflow, which may indicate the next tasks to be done once it is completed, with success or with errors</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Direct Workflow Task</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflow -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflow"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Workflow"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#consistsOf"/> <owl:allValuesFrom> <owl:Class> <owl:unionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflow"/> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflowTask"/> </owl:unionOf> </owl:Class> </owl:allValuesFrom> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">In reverse workflow all relationships in workflow task graph are dependencies. In order to run this type of workflow we need to specify a task that needs to be completed, it can be conventionally called ‘target task’. When a workflow engine starts a workflow it recursively identifies all the dependencies that need to be completed first.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Reverse Workflow</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflowTask -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflowTask"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Task"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#requires"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#ReverseWorkflowTask"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A task in a reverse workflow, which may indicate the tasks that are required to be finished before this one starts</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Reverse Workflow Task</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Task -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Task"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#input"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#output"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#outputOnError"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#action"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onClass> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/action-type"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </owl:onClass> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">Tasks define specific computational steps in a workflow. When the workflow engine processes entities described in the workflow text it schedules tasks for execution</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Task</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#action"/> <owl:allValuesFrom> <owl:Class> <owl:intersectionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#inScheme"/> <owl:hasValue rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/kos/action-type"/> </owl:Restriction> </owl:intersectionOf> </owl:Class> </owl:allValuesFrom> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#item"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#ConfigurationItem"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#context"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#valueorExpression"/> <owl:qualifiedCardinality rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#nonNegativeInteger">1</owl:qualifiedCardinality> <owl:onDataRange rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Variable may be used as an input or output of a Workflow or a Task. It is defined in a context, it has some value or can be described with an expression, and may refer to one or several Configuration Items</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Variable</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
<!-- http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Workflow -->
<owl:Class rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Workflow"> <rdfs:subClassOf rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/core#Resource"/> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#consistsOf"/> <owl:allValuesFrom> <owl:Class> <owl:unionOf rdf:parseType="Collection"> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Task"/> <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Workflow"/> </owl:unionOf> </owl:Class> </owl:allValuesFrom> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#input"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#output"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:subClassOf> <owl:Restriction> <owl:onProperty rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#outputOnError"/> <owl:allValuesFrom rdf:resource="http://w3id.org/devops-infra/workflow#Variable"/> </owl:Restriction> </rdfs:subClassOf> <rdfs:comment xml:lang="en">A Workflow is a process that can be described in a various number of ways and that can do some job interesting to the end user. Each workflow consists of tasks (at least one) describing what exact steps should be made during workflow execution.</rdfs:comment> <rdfs:label xml:lang="en">Workflow</rdfs:label> </owl:Class>
